Nelson wrote:

> Given that all classes {C} implement interface X, it would prolly be
> most logical to define test methods which all assert the successful
> functionality for an instance of every class in {C}. This way, we can
> be  sure all implementations correctly work at runtime while reusing
> as much test code as possible.

Please Google "AbstractTestCase".
